title: Emmerdale fans' suicide fears for 'broken' Moira after noticing worrying detail
text:

Emmerdale fans are fearing the worst for Moira Dingle, convinced that she is "broken" and could even be contemplating suicide.

Moira's erratic behaviour, including her affair with Nate, with over the last few months has thoroughly confused fans.

After her secret romps were exposed, she finally discovered Nate's secret identity - that he was actually Cain's long-lost son.

As a result, Moira (Natalie J Robb) went from 0 to 100 and decided to destroy Nate's caravan... after threatening to shoot him with a shotgun.

The constant switching between extreme emotions - dead-eyed, lust-fuelled, fury - has had some fans convinced that there is something darker going on behind the scenes.

One fans tweeted: "Love Moira, but she needs help & fast. No sibling, mum, dad...I feel like she’s all alone. Cain & Moira have Isaac. Even though Cain is Cain I’m seeing him in a different light. He’s hurt, badly. Nate is hurting, all three are hurting for different reasons #Emmerdale."

While another commented: "I felt sorry 4 Moira so shoot me. She knows she's done wrong but the way she collapsed in Matty's arms showed she's broken & lashed out only way knew how. Sad 2 when Kyle ran to her & gave her a hug. Agreed w/Mandy that Cain shouldn't keep the kids frm seeing Moira #emmerdale."

A third remarked: "Emmerdale need to allow Moira time to build up her mental health. She’s a strong women,but over the past 3 years they’ve worn her to the ground. Made her unrecognisable! #emmerdale."

Moira has suffered much tragedy in her life, with her former husband John Barton dying after his car fell off a ravine in February 2012 and daughter Holly tragically overdosing in September 2016.

She then began spiraling out of control, which included killing Emma by pushing her off the viaduct.

Subsequently, her son Adam took the wrap and went on the run for police. Has Moira been struggling to deal with everything that has happened to her in her life? And could it all have devastating consequences?

*Emmerdale airs tonight at 7pm on ITV
